title: Axiom space mission: Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla to fly to International Space Station on May 29
content: The Axiom Mission 4 crew will be launched aboard a SpaceX Dragon spacecraft to the ISS and will spend up to 14 days at the orbiting laboratory.

title: LDF govt.’s four-year celebrations riddled with corruption, alleges Chennithala
content: Mr. Chennithala criticised the government for not inviting Leader of the Opposition V.D. Satheesan to the commissioning of the Vizhinjam port

title: Goshree islanders annoyed over ‘unscientific’ schedule of private and KSRTC buses
content: Poorly planned timings for nine private and ten KSRTC buses, launched recently on city routes, have led to their inefficient use, resulting in inadequate revenue from sale of tickets

title: Withdrawal of discount cards by KMRL deals a blow to city students’ travel plans
content: This has increased my travel cost, and is also causing delays, sometimes making us late for class, says a student as she is left with no choice but to depend on buses to reach her college

title: Digha’s Jagannath Temple inauguration is Trinamool’s Ram temple moment
content: In the highly polarised political landscape of Bengal, the Jagannath Temple is the ruling party’s answer to the allegations of being ‘fake-Hindu’ levelled at it by the BJP

title: Second harassment incident within months: Senior CPI(M) MP expelled from party in Kolkata
content: This is the second such incident of harassment and suspension among senior party leadership in West Bengal

title: Mamata donates ₹5 lakh broom for Jagannath temple, participates in yagna ahead of inauguration
content: The inaugural programme of the Jagannath temple at Digha will be held Wednesday after which the gates of the temple will be opened for the general public

title: PM Narendra Modi To Chair Key Cabinet Panel Meet Today. Why It Is Significant
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will chair a crucial meeting of the "Cabinet Committee on Political Affairs" or CCPA -- the most important committee of the cabinet that has also been dubbed the "Super Cabinet".

title: Shifting Wind Patterns May Delay Flight Operations: Delhi Airport Operator
content: Delhi airport operator DIAL on Tuesday said flights may be delayed due to shifting wind patterns in the vicinity of the airport.

title: Maharashtra Acquires Raghuji Bhonsle's Sword For Rs 47 Lakh At London Auction
content: The Maharashtra Government has acquired the famous "Raghuji Sword" of the 18th century Maratha general Raghuji Bhonsle for Rs 47.15 lakh at an auction in London, Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said on Tuesday.

title: Inconsistent Judicial Decisions Shake Public Trust: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court on Tuesday observed inconsistent decisions from different benches shook public trust and outlined their consistency to be hallmark of a responsible judiciary.

title: Pahalgam Terror Attack: PM Modi Meets RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat met Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday, an interaction which has come in the backdrop of the horrific Pahalgam terror attack that left 26 civilians, mostly tourists, dead.

title: Donald Trump Calls Jeff Bezos After Amazon Reveals Tariffs On Goods
content: Trump's tariffs on Chinese imports, set at 145%, will significantly impact Amazon, as a substantial portion of its sales come from smaller, independent retailers that rely heavily on imports.

title: India, Pak's Harmonious Coexistence Vital For Region's Stability: China
content: China on Tuesday reiterated its call for India and Pakistan to exercise restraint, saying their harmonious coexistence is vital to the peace, stability and development of the region.

title: Probe Agency Seizes 45 Vintage Cars After Raids In Hyderabad
content: ED on Tuesday said it has seized 45 old cars, including some vintage ones, apart from Rs 23 lakh in cash and some foreign currency during searches in Hyderabad in a money laundering case linked to alleged illegal sale of government.

title: Pakistan's 4-Point Plan Over Indus Waters Treaty, And Why It Won't Work
content: Pakistan, thirsty for some legal action over New Delhi's move to place the Indus Waters Treaty in "abeyance", is planning to take India to international court in a desperate attempt to find some reprieve.

title: In Call With S Jaishankar, UN Chief Condemns Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres reiterated his condemnation of the Pahalgam terror attack in a call with External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar

title: 3 Killed, Several Injured In Shooting In Swedish City: Cops
content: Several people were injured during a shooting in the Swedish city of Uppsala on Tuesday, police said.

title: After Pak Airspace Closure, San Francisco-Delhi Flight Time Up 4 Hours
content: After India unveiled a slew of diplomatic measures following last week's terrorist attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam, in which 26 people were killed, Pakistan responded by - among other steps - closing its airspace to Indian airlines.

title: Congress Deletes 'Gayab' Post Targeting PM Modi After Outrage
content: The Congress has taken down the social media post that targeted Prime Minister Narendra Modi, saying he was missing in action during the all-party meet to discuss the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam that cost 26 lives.

title: Facebook Parent Meta Platforms Launches Standalone AI Assistant App
content: Facebook parent Meta Platforms on Tuesday launched a separate app for its Meta AI assistant, similar to those offered by Microsoft-backed OpenAI and Alphabet's Google.

title: Indian Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla To Fly To Space Station On May 29
content: Indian Air Force (IAF) Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla will fly to the International Space Station (ISS) on May 29, Axiom Space Inc announced on Tuesday, as he is set to become the first Indian to do so.

title: Shaurya Chakra Awardee's Mother Won't Be Deported To Pak: Relative
content: Days after the tragic Pahalgam attack, Jammu and Kashmir authorities have transported 59 Pakistani nationals to Punjab for their repatriation to their country of origin, officials in Srinagar said.

title: 'Decide on targets, mode, timing': PM Modi gives complete freedom to forces to avenge Pahalgam
content: Following the Pahalgam terrorist attack that resulted in the deaths of 26 civilians, Prime Minister Narendra Modi has granted the Indian armed forces complete autonomy. They can now decide on the method, targets, and timing of their response. A high-level meeting was convened, attended by key paramilitary force heads, to address the heightened tensions and security concerns in the region.

title: Harvard under fire for hosting Pakistan conference after Pahalgam terror attack
content: Harvard's South Asia Institute, funded by Laxmi Mittal, faced backlash for hosting a "Pakistan conference" after Indian students protested, citing concerns about platforming a government allegedly enabling terrorism. Pakistan, facing embarrassment and criticism, vowed to revive its academic presence in the US. The conference sparked debate about Harvard's role and Pakistan's influence in American academia.

title: J&K attack: UN chief calls Jaishankar, Pak PM; offers de-escalation support
content: UN Secretary-General António Guterres condemned the Pahalgam terror attack in calls with India and Pakistan, emphasizing accountability. Jaishankar agreed on the importance of bringing perpetrators to justice, while Sharif urged the UN to counsel India to exercise restraint. PM Modi has granted the armed forces full authority to respond decisively to terrorism.

title: 3 dead in Sweden shooting; gunman at large
content: Swedish police are investigating a shooting in Uppsala after multiple people were injured in the city centre. Authorities received numerous calls reporting loud bangs, and officers arriving at the scene discovered individuals with injuries consistent with gunfire. A large area has been cordoned off as investigators work to determine the circumstances surrounding the incident.

title: IPL: Delhi Capitals' home troubles continue as KKR keep themselves alive
content: Kolkata Knight Riders defeated Delhi Capitals by 14 runs, snapping their three-match winless streak. KKR's Sunil Narine's all-round performance and crucial wickets of Axar Patel and Faf du Plessis turned the game. Despite a strong start, KKR's innings slowed, while DC's struggles against spin continued, with the visitors' spinners claiming multiple wickets.

title: Chinese company in the US takes on Nvidia with AI chip
content: Despite U.S. restrictions, Huawei is developing the Ascend 910D, a powerful AI processor aiming to rival Nvidia's H100 chip. This move highlights China's resilience in the semiconductor industry and its push for technological self-sufficiency. Huawei plans to ship significant quantities of its Ascend chips, demonstrating its ability to overcome challenges and compete in the AI sector.

title: IPL 2025 Points Table: Latest standings after DC vs KKR match
content: Kolkata Knight Riders secured a 14-run victory against Delhi Capitals in a thrilling IPL 2025 match. Sunil Narine and Varun Chakaravarthy's spin bowling restricted Delhi's chase. Angkrish Raghuvanshi and Rinku Singh contributed crucial runs for Kolkata. Faf du Plessis and Axar Patel's partnership couldn't save Delhi. Kolkata's win keeps their playoff hopes alive, intensifying the competition.

title: Mark Carney strong, yet just short: How Liberals fell short in Canada polls
content: Mark Carney's Liberals surged in the polls, fueled by his 'Canada Strong' message and perceived ability to counter Trump. However, a late shift in Trump's rhetoric allowed the Conservatives to close the gap, resulting in a Liberal minority government. Carney now faces navigating a minority parliament, needing support from other parties to enact his agenda amid economic uncertainty.

title: Xi 'sends message' to tech firms as DeepSeek called threat to US national security
content: President Xi Jinping has declared AI a strategic priority, urging China to lead in this transformative field. China aims for self-reliance in AI, balancing innovation with safety. Despite progress, concerns arise over data privacy and potential military applications, particularly with AI models like DeepSeek. Amidst U.S.

title: Congress deletes 'gayab' post on PM Modi after backlash
content: The Congress party removed a controversial post criticizing PM Modi for his alleged lack of responsibility regarding the Pahalgam attack, following strong objections from the BJP. The BJP accused Congress of using divisive imagery, while Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge criticized the Prime Minister for prioritizing an election rally over an all-party meeting to discuss the terror attack.

title: Watch: Ivanka's son debuts his first original composition for 'Grandpa'
content: Ivanka Trump shared a heartwarming video of her son, Theo, playing his original piano composition for his grandfather, President Donald Trump, at the White House. The performance garnered praise online, with many applauding Theo's talent. Earlier, Ivanka posted about the Eagles' Super Bowl victory celebration, where Theo playfully challenged Saquon Barkley to a race.

title: One week of Pahalgam terror attack: How India-Pak relations worsened
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, India-Pakistan relations worsen. Firing across the LoC continues. India retaliates strongly. Anti-terror operations intensify in Kashmir. India suspends the Indus Waters Treaty and Simla Agreement. Pakistani visas are suspended. Diplomats are expelled. Pakistan proposes a neutral probe. London investigates a Pakistani diplomat's gesture towards Indian protesters. India takes strong actions against Pakistan.

title: Microsoft’s chief HR writes to managers on cutting low performers
content: Microsoft is implementing stricter performance management policies, including a two-year rehire ban for underperformers and restrictions on internal transfers. These changes aim to accelerate high performance and swiftly address low performance, aligning with industry trends toward performance-based evaluations. The company is also introducing AI-supported tools to aid managers in performance conversations.

title: Watch: A 106m six, a stunning catch & a review after run-out in one over
content: A dramatic final over defined Kolkata Knight Riders' innings against Delhi Capitals. Andre Russell's monstrous six and a series of wickets, including a stunning catch, electrified the Arun Jaitley Stadium. Delhi's bizarre review for a non-existent edge after a run-out added to the spectacle. KKR ultimately reached 204/9, but the over's thrilling twists and turns stole the show.

title: Akshaya Tritiya: 30+ wishes, messages, quotes, images to share
content: Akshaya Tritiya, an auspicious Hindu and Jain festival on April 30, 2025, is celebrated for its promise of unending prosperity. The day encourages investments and new ventures, believed to bring lasting success. Beyond gold purchases, the article suggests sharing heartfelt wishes and embracing the day's positive energy with family and friends through messages and social media posts.

title: US consumer confidence sinks to 5-year low amid tariffs, recession fears
content: American consumer confidence has plummeted to its lowest point since the pandemic's start, driven by tariff concerns under President Trump's administration. The Conference Board reported a significant drop in April, with nearly a third of consumers anticipating job slowdowns, reminiscent of the Great Recession.

title: 22-year-old India-Pakistan ceasefire pact hangs by a thread as armies exchange fire for 4th day in J&K
content: Officials said a zipline operator, questioned by the NIA after a viral video, had ‘no role’ in the Pahalgam attack

title: State announces Financial assistance of ₹50 lakh to Pahalgam attack victims
content: Six natives of Maharashtra — Sanjay Lele, Hemant Joshi, Atul Mone (all Dombivli residents ), Dilip Disle (Panvel), Kaustubh Ganbote and Santosh Jagdale (residents of Pune) — were killed in the Pahalgam terror attack

title: Karnataka orders closure of Auxiliary Nursing Midwife courses, ANMTC centres
content: The already enrolled students have been asked to move to B.Sc. Nursing/General Nursing and Midwife (GNM) course

title: BRS rebuts Govt. point-wise on NDSA report on Kaleshwaram project Barrages
content: Harish Rao asks Congress Govt. why it had not taken up Tummidihatti Barrage till 2014 after taking up Pranahita-Chevalla project in 2007

title: Tejashwi promises safety to the Vaishya community and ticket in Assembly election
content: Mr. Yadav accused that the central and state governments were harassing the Vaishya community economically. He claimed that due to incidents of murder, robbery, crime and atrocities against businessmen, fear prevails among them.

title: Attorney General of India R. Venkataramani is set to hold all–India conference to promote mediation
content: Chief Justices and Advocate Generals of various states will attend the conference, which will be inaugurated by President Droupadi Murmu.

title: Like Kashmir, go after terrorists from Myanmar too: Manipur group
content: The Coordinating Committee on Manipur Integrity resented the Centre’s double standards in dealing with terror groups on two different frontiers of India

title: ED attaches over 1000 acres of land of a company accused of illegal financial dealings
content: The ED says the action has been taken under the provisions of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA), 2002

title: Insufficient support for deep tech, startups by public-funded R&D: Study
content: Labs of the ‘strategic sector’ such as those belonging to defence research, space, atomic energy research — all of which constitute the lion’s share of India’s overall Research and Development (R&D) spend — were excluded from the study due to the “sensitive nature of their work”

title: Rahul Gandhi reviews development projects in Rae Bareli, visits rail coach factory
content: As part of his itinerary, the Leader of Opposition is likely to visit family of youth killed in Pahalgam terror attack

title: Cyber attacks on four defence-affiliated facilities by Pakistan-based groups thwarted
content: The websites of two Army Public Schools, the Army Welfare Housing Organisation database, and the Indian Air Force Placement Organisation were promptly isolated, and restorative action taken

title: Collector urges more individuals, MSMEs to participate in P4 initiative
content: Mentors must ensure that the families they assist come out of poverty and have enough means to sustain themselves.

title: BMTC to roll out 320 AC electric buses in Bengaluru by May-end
content: Electric buses are supplied by OHM Global Mobility, a subsidiary of Ashok Leyland, under the Gross Cost Contract model

title: Newly-wed CRPF jawan’s wife among women on J&K repatriation list
content: Political leaders across the spectrum have criticised the repatriations, and have called on the Centre to adopt a rational and humanitarian approach

title: Supreme Court asks Sambhal mosque management to respond to Uttar Pradesh report on disputed well
content: The U.P. government’s status report said that a disputed well stood ‘completely outside’ the mosque precincts, contrary to what the Muslim side said in the apex court

title: PM Modi congratulates Carney on election victory; signals possible reset in ties with Canada
content: Prime Minister’s reference to India and Canada sharing “democratic values” with “commitment to rule of law” paints a picture of political hopes for positive bilateral relations, after two years of tensions following allegations in Nijjar killing case.

title: Justice B.R. Gavai appointed next Chief Justice of India, to take charge on May 14
content: Justice Gavai will have a tenure of six months and would demit office on December 23 on attaining the age of 65.

title: Three Naga Militants Killed In 60-Hour Operation In Assam
content: At least three suspected NSCN (National Socialist Council of Nagaland) cadres, who entered Assam allegedly to extort money from the National Highways Authority of India, were killed in an encounter with security forces in Dima Hasao district.

title: Delhi Police Head Constable Arrested On Charges Of Corruption
content: The Vigilance unit of Delhi Police has arrested head constable for allegedly demanding and accepting a bribe, a statement said on Tuesday.

title: Watch: Chameera puts on his cape, takes absolute stunner
content: Dushmantha Chameera's sensational catch stole the show in a thrilling IPL 2025 match between Delhi Capitals and Kolkata Knight Riders. His unbelievable grab at backward square leg dismissed Anukul Roy, leaving everyone stunned. Despite Venkatesh Iyer's 75 and Angkrish Raghuvanshi's 44, KKR were restricted to 204/9, with Mitchell Starc taking 3/33.

title: Justice BR Gavai appointed next Chief Justice of India
content: Justice Bhushan Ramkrishna Gavai was appointed as the 52nd Chief Justice of India. He will succeed CJI Sanjiv Khanna. President Droupadi Murmu will administer the oath on May 14. Gavai was born in Amravati on November 24, 1960. He joined the Bar in 1985 and became a High Court judge in 2005.

title: Maxwell mocks Chahal after Dhoni's gift: 'What are you gonna do with it?'
content: Yuzvendra Chahal's joy over receiving a bat from MS Dhoni was short-lived as Glenn Maxwell playfully trolled him in the Punjab Kings dressing room. Maxwell questioned Chahal's use of the bat, given his frequent substitution as an Impact Player. Despite the banter, Chahal has been performing well, securing nine wickets in nine matches.

title: India’s Shubhanshu Shukla to fly to ISS on May 29
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla will pilot the Axiom-4 mission to the ISS, launching from Florida. The mission will conduct around 60 scientific studies, including seven from India, focusing on microgravity research in human health, agriculture, and biotechnology. This mission marks a step towards commercial space stations and sustained access to low Earth orbit.

title: Canada elections: How Mark Carney pulled off 'Mission Impossible'
content: Justin Trudeau’s political brand, once associated with youthful optimism and progressive momentum, had become a liability by early 2025. After nearly a decade as Prime Minister, Trudeau faced plummeting approval ratings, fueled by high food prices, a worsening housing crisis, and lingering ethics scandals. Internal dissent within the Liberal Party reached a breaking point, culminating in Trudeau’s resignation in January.

title: Will not engage in market dumping: Chinese envoy reassures India
content: Amid trade war concerns, Beijing assures India it won't flood markets with cheap goods, emphasizing compliance with WTO rules and focus on domestic demand. China aims to avoid disrupting other nations' economies, even as India imposes tariffs on steel imports. Both countries seek enhanced cooperation and deeper trade engagement, marking a potential thaw in relations.

title: Anurag Thakur slams Cong over Pahalgam remarks: 'Are you with Hindustan or Pak?'
content: Union Minister Anurag Thakur has strongly criticized Congress following the Pahalgam terror attack, questioning their allegiance. Thakur accused Congress leaders of echoing pro-Pakistan sentiments and undermining India's security efforts. He highlighted comments from leaders like Saifuddin Soz, who suggested considering Pakistan's denial of involvement. Congress distanced itself from individual remarks, emphasizing that only official party statements reflect their stance.

title: Watch: Heated exchange between Parag and Deshpande; Bond intervenes
content: During a strategic time-out in the IPL match between Rajasthan Royals and Gujarat Titans, Riyan Parag and Tushar Deshpande were involved in a heated exchange, prompting intervention from coach Shane Bond. This incident occurred after RR's dominant run-chase, fueled by Vaibhav Suryavanshi's century, secured a historic victory. Despite the win, the spat highlights the high emotions in the tournament.

title: Jadeja blasts Gill for 'not giving enough credit' to Vaibhav Suryavanshi
content: Ajay Jadeja has criticised Shubman Gill's dismissive remarks about 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi's record-breaking century for Rajasthan Royals. Gill called the innings "lucky," but Jadeja argued that Suryavanshi's brilliance deserved more appreciation, especially considering his age and the pressure involved. Suryavanshi's explosive 101 off 38 balls included 11 sixes and broke multiple IPL records, solidifying his status as a rising star.

title: How Trump is wrecking international students’ lives & careers
content: Since 9/11, international students in the U.S. have faced increasing scrutiny, particularly under the Trump administration, with SEVIS data being weaponized. Minor infractions, political activity, and research interests have led to targeting, causing fear and self-deportation. Despite the role of International Offices in fostering global culture, they are also ICE's first stop for deportations, jeopardizing the legacy of intercultural education.

title: 'We say Allahu Akbar even in storms': Pahalgam zipline operator’s father
content: Amidst the Pahalgam terror attack probe, zipline operator Muzammil's father defended his son's 'Allahu Akbar' shout, calling it a natural expression of faith. A Gujarat tourist alleged Muzammil uttered the phrase thrice before the firing. The video of the incident went viral, adding controversy to the investigation of the attack that killed 26 tourists.

title: CISCE to announce ICSE & ISC results on this date: How to check
content: The Council for the Indian School Certificate Examinations (CISCE) will announce the ICSE (Class X) and ISC (Class XII) Year 2025 results on April 30, 2025 at 11.00 am. Results will be available on the CISCE website, CAREERS portal, and DigiLocker. Detailed steps to access results, apply for recheck, re-evaluation, and improvement examinations have been outlined. The recheck window will remain open till May 4, 2025. Improvement exams will be held in July 2025.

title: 100 days, 140 orders: Key numbers that explain Trump 2.0
content: In his first 100 days, President Trump's second term has been marked by a flurry of executive actions, including 140 executive orders and significant tariff increases, most notably on Chinese imports. Immigration enforcement has intensified, leading to 139,000 deportations and a sharp decline in border crossings.

title: 'Good option …': Rahane on Vaibhav Arora's omission from KKR XI vs DC
content: In a surprising move, Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) dropped their joint highest wicket-taker, Vaibhav Arora, for Anukul Roy in a crucial match against Delhi Capitals. Skipper Ajinkya Rahane cited pitch conditions as the reason for the change, aiming for spin variety. Delhi Capitals, led by Axar Patel, chose to bowl first, anticipating dew.

title: 'Big goals, limited time': Did PM Modi hint at plan to avenge Pahalgam?
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, PM Narendra Modi assures a strong response. He emphasizes India's resolve to combat cross-border terrorism. Modi pledges justice for the victims and vows to punish the perpetrators. He reiterates the nation's commitment to identifying, tracking, and punishing terrorists and their supporters. The Prime Minister assures the world that India will not be broken by terrorism.

title: CID 2 Promo: ACP Pradyuman and Ayushman to have a major face-off
content: CID is set to deliver more drama with its latest promo, showcasing ACP Pradyuman confronting ACP Ayushman, played by Parth Samthaan. Abhijeet faces a life-threatening situation while rescuing a child, leaving Daya anxious. Fans are reacting strongly to these developments, expressing concern for Abhijeet's fate and curiosity about Ayushman's backstory. The return of ACP Pradyuman promises further intriguing twists.

title: Karnataka High Court directs BSWML to complete tender to chose contractors for city’s solid waste management within four months
content: The court allows Bangalore Solid Waste Management Ltd to go ahead with tender invited on November 7, 2024 but allows disqualified or unsuccessful biders also to participate in the present tender

title: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat meets Prime Minister Modi in wake of Pahalgam terror attack
content: In the hour-long meeting, also attended by Amit Shah, the security situation in Kashmir as well as the proposed response were discussed

title: CIFT incubatee recognised as Best Fisheries Startup
content: The fisheries meet is organised by the Union government under the Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana

title: Object behind POCSO Act will be defeated if offence is condoned due to romantic relationships or subsequent marriage: Madras High Court
content: Justice P. Velmurugan punishes a youngster to 10 years of imprisonment for having had sexual intercourse with his wife when she was a minor

title:
From prohibition to monopoly: tracing liquor policy and emergence of 
TASMAC
content: M.G. Ramachandran’s government decided in 1983 to take over the wholesale trade in arrack and Indian Made Foreign Spirits from June 1, 1983. An ordinance to this effect was promulgated by the Governor. A public sector corporation, known as Tamil Nadu State Marketing Corporation, was formed for supply of arrack and IMFS to retailers

title: When ‘anti-liquor propaganda’ gathered momentum in Madras nearly a century ago
content: On October 22, 1927, the Madras Legislative Council passed a resolution recommending to the British India government that total prohibition in the Presidency within a course of 20 years be declared its goal. District committees were formed in the Presidency for the propaganda. It was halted after September 1931 because of financial stringency

title: Suspended IPS officer Anjaneyulu grilled for two days in Bollywood actress case
content: The CID police had arrested the suspended IPS officer on April 21, from his residence in Hyderabad. The court granted three days police custody of the accused

title: A school at Mylapore that takes in the poor
content: The school derived its name from St. Ebba, the daughter of the King of Northumbria. A plaque at the school entrance gives details of St. Ebba. She lived in 7 A.D. and became a Scottish saint.

title: No change in outsourcing of operation and maintenance of new bus terminal, says Tiruchi Mayor
content: The swanky new bus terminal was one of the largest bus stands in the country and required a dedicated team to maintain it, says Tiruchi Mayor M. Anbazhagan

title: 'If you support them ... ': Pawan Kalyan on leaders' pro-Pak remarks
content: Andhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan has strongly condemned pro-Pakistan sentiments expressed by some individuals in India, particularly during national crises. He urged those who harbor affection for Pakistan to relocate there. Kalyan's remarks referenced televised debates where certain leaders allegedly showed support for Pakistan. This statement follows the recent terrorist attack that killed 26 civilians.

title: Soiled, or damaged currency notes? Check RBI guidelines for exchange
content: The Reserve Bank of India has established guidelines for exchanging damaged currency notes, ensuring that individuals don't face financial losses due to soiled, mutilated, or severely damaged notes. Banks are mandated to accept these notes, with refunds depending on the extent of the damage, and severely damaged notes require RBI evaluation.

title: Big IPL records in RR vs GT clash overshadowed by Suryavanshi's knock
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old prodigy, stunned the IPL with a record-breaking 38-ball 101, leading Rajasthan Royals to a dominant victory over Gujarat Titans. His 35-ball century, the fastest by an Indian in IPL history, highlighted an evening of shattered records, including the highest partnership for Rajasthan Royals and the fastest 200+ run chase in IPL history.

title: 'Unholy builder-bank nexus': SC orders CBI probe into Supertech projects
content: The Supreme Court has instructed the CBI to launch seven preliminary investigations into suspected collusion between major banks and real estate developers across several Indian cities. This action aims to protect defrauded homebuyers in areas like Noida, Gurugram, and Mumbai. The court noted evidence suggesting a nexus between financial institutions and builders, leading to financial exploitation.

title: Pratika Rawal breaks 28-year-old record, becomes fastest to ...
content: India's Pratika Rawal has shattered records, becoming the fastest woman to reach 500 ODI runs in just eight innings, surpassing Charlotte Edwards' previous record. During the tri-series in Sri Lanka, Rawal's impressive 78-run innings against South Africa cemented her achievement. With 572 runs at an average of 81.71, she's now second-fastest overall, only behind Janneman Malan.

title: Pahalgam attack: Pakistani terrorist a former para commando, finds probe
content: Investigations reveal Hashim Musa, the Pakistani terrorist behind the Pahalgam massacre, is a former para commando from Pakistan's special forces. Sources indicate Musa, now with LeT, was deployed to J&K to target non-locals and security forces.

title: Preity Zinta on raising her children as Hindus: I am facing constant criticism
content: Preity Zinta, set to return to the screen with 'Lahore 1947,' recently addressed speculation about her political aspirations. Responding to queries on X, she clarified that her temple visits and pride in her identity don't equate to joining politics. She added that she's raising her children as Hindus as she understands the importance of her roots and culture after staying away from India.

title: 'Complete collapse of the system': Spanish PM on massive blackout across Europe
content: A massive power outage plunged Spain, Portugal, France, and Belgium into chaos on Monday, disrupting transport and daily life. Millions were affected as trains halted, flights were grounded, and mobile signals went down. Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez described it as an unprecedented “complete collapse,” with Spain losing 60% of its national energy demand in seconds.

title: 'Suryavanshi cheering for my then team': Goenka's post goes viral
content: Sanjiv Goenka's nostalgic post featuring Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a young fan from 2017, has captivated social media. Suryavanshi, now 14, recently stunned the IPL with a record-breaking 38-ball century against Gujarat Titans. His journey, fueled by family sacrifice and relentless practice, highlights the IPL's role in showcasing India's emerging cricketing talent, marking a full-circle moment.

title: NEP changed country’s education system: PM
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi says new initiatives have enhanced access to modern education and new career pathways. He adds that the research system has improved with increased resources and funding

title: No cholera outbreak situation in capital, health standing committee chairperson
content: Modern slaughterhouse in Kunnukuzhy will be inaugurated soon as part of State government’s fourth anniversary celebrations, says Mayor

title: Muslim Law Board resumes Waqf stir, calls for ‘Lights Off’ protest
content: The Board has opted to hold closed door meetings and protests in stadiums and halls to avoid “unrest” and “disturbance” from unruly elements

title: Samajwadi Party speaking like Pakistan’s spokesperson: CM Adityanath
content: Uttar Pradesh CM hits out at SP leader for divisive statements like a “Hindu killing Hindu” and accused the SP and the Congress of using caste-based politics and appeasement

title: Congress says India must oppose any fresh IMF assistance to Pakistan
content: The principal Opposition party also asked what steps the Centre had taken to bring back the BSF jawan who strayed into Pakistani territory on April 23

title: Those who love Pakistan can leave the country: Pawan Kalyan
content: Rohingyas who fled from Myanmar are now present in Andhra Pradesh too, the Deputy Chief Minister pointed out

title: CM likely to unveil Sivaji Ganesan’s statue at a new spot in Tiruchi
content: The nine-foot-tall bronze statue, which was made in 2011, has been moved from Palakkarai to the Williams Road-Warners Road junction and is likely to unveiled by the CM

title: Have several plans to support poor people, says police constable who became an IPS officer
content: Though he joined the police force as a constable, M. Udaya Krishna Reddy resigned after facing several insults and finally pursued his dream of becoming an IPS officer within seven years of his resignation

title: Nod for three private industrial estates in Ernakulam
content: The private industrial estates project is a flagship programme by the State government aimed at bringing about 350 acres under industrial use

title: Andhra Pradesh’s Annual Credit Plan for 2025-26 fixed at ₹6.6 lakh crore
content: It is up 22% over the previous year; agriculture sector gets ₹3.06 lakh crore and  MSMEs ₹1.28 lakh crore; Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu exhorts bankers to extend their support to the government’s initiatives with  focus on development, wealth creation and poverty eradication

title: Three killed, three injured in blast at DRDO-linked rocket propellant unit in Yadadri
content: Six persons were inside the propellant mixing unit of Premier Explosives Limited at the time of the blast, which is said to have been triggered during mixing of two powerful propellants

title: KSEB repeating lies on Athirappilly project, say environmental activists
content: Project will wipe out two tribal hamlets, displace 100-odd families, says tribal chief. Meeting planned on May 2 resist move

title: Minister kickstarts road works at TGIIC’s Mobility Valley Park in Vikarabad district
content: The park will be spread over 862 acres and expected to generate jobs for nearly 10,000 youth: Industries and IT Minister D. Sridhar Babu

title: A genial footballer set to hang up his police boots
content: I.M. Vijayan, the former Indian footballer, who first donned the khaki as a police constable is retiring today as the deputy commandant of the MSP. He was promoted just a day earlier in recognition of his contributions to Indian football

title: Close down all illegal homestays and cottages in Nilgiris & Kodaikanal, orders Madras High Court
content: Justices N. Sathish Kumar and D. Bharatha Chakravarthy take serious note of tourists being fleeced by such unauthorised accommodations in the hill stations

title: 'They tell you to keep it down -- don't listen': 30 years of Coors Field pitching horror stories
content: For three decades, baseball at the Rockies' park has bruised ERAs and egos. Here's what it's like on MLB's scariest mound.

title: Sources: Kings finalizing deal for Christie as HC
content: The Sacramento Kings and interim coach Doug Christie are finalizing a multiyear contract to make him the franchise's next head coach, sources told ESPN.

title: Source: Possible Alexander remains with Packers
content: A source tells ESPN that all options are on the table for the Packers and All-Pro cornerback Jaire Alexander, including a possible return to Green Bay next season.

title: Struggling Djokovic withdraws from Italian Open
content: No. 5-ranked Novak Djokovic, in the midst of a three-match losing streak, has pulled out of the Italian Open, putting in question how well he'll be able to play at the French Open.

title: 49ers' Kittle: 4-year extension worth $76.4M
content: Tight end George Kittle, who was entering the final year of a deal he signed in 2020 with the 49ers, said Tuesday on the "Bussin' With The Boys" podcast that he signed a four-year, $76.4 million extension.

title: RB Dobbins receives rare UFA tender from Bolts
content: Running back J.K. Dobbins and wide receiver Elijah Moore received the seldom-used unrestricted free agent tender from the Chargers and Browns, respectively.

title: Source: WR Johnson to Browns after strange '24
content: The Browns reached agreement on a one-year contract with free agent wide receiver Diontae Johnson on Monday.

title: No charges for man over hockey player's death
content: British prosecutors said Tuesday no charges will be brought against a man arrested on suspicion of manslaughter following the death of ice hockey player Adam Johnson in 2023.

title: The rare play that saves Ja, Donovan Mitchell and other NBA stars -- and it traces back to 1957
content: Players seem to be throwing the ball off the glass to themselves more than ever, and not just to generate highlights.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Will Maple Leafs and Hurricanes move on to Round 2?
content: Tuesday may be the end for the Sens and Devils, while pivotal Games 5 transpire in Wild-Knights, Oilers-Kings.

title: After a disappointing weekend, the power now belongs to Shedeur Sanders
content: From here on out, all that matters for Shedeur Sanders is proving the Browns were right in selecting him.

title: Bracketology: Debut predictions for the 2025-26 season
content: With a bevy of returning talent, Purdue earns the top overall seed in the first edition of our projected field.

title: Sources: Ancelotti to coach Brazil for June games
content: The Brazil Football Federation (CBF) expects Carlo Ancelotti to be coach of the national team in time to manage a pair of CONMEBOL World Cup qualifiers in June, sources have told ESPN Brasil.

title: Martinelli open to battle as Arsenal eye striker
content: Gabriel Martinelli has suggested Arsenal need to bolster their attack this summer and welcomes the competition for places any new arrivals would bring.

title: Sources: Rüdiger out of El Clásico, doubt for CWC
content: Real Madrid defender Antonio Rüdiger is expected to be out of action for up to two months, sources have told ESPN, after undergoing knee surgery on Tuesday.

title: Luis Enrique blasts media ahead of Arsenal SF
content: Luis Enrique has hit back at what he believes is unfair negativity surrounding his Paris Saint-Germain side on the eve of their Champions League semifinal against Arsenal.

title: Wolves women 'devastated' by promotion snub
content: Wolves women's players have said they feel "let down" after learning the club failed to submit an application for promotion to the Championship.

title: Rugby chiefs open to Chelsea groundshare
content: The RFU would be open to ground sharing the Allianz Stadium Twickenham with Chelsea if the Premier League giants opt to redevelop Stamford Bridge.

title: Klopp congratulates Liverpool, Slot for PL win
content: Jürgen Klopp has congratulated Liverpool and his successor Arne Slot after they won the Premier League title this season.

title: Source: Villa fear Rashford out for the season
content: Villa fear Rashford could miss the rest of the season with the hamstring injury which kept him out of the FA Cup semifinal, a source has told ESPN.

title: Man United stand between Athletic and a dream Europa League final at home
content: Four teams have won a UEFA final at home. Athletic want to be No. 5. First they must beat Man United in the Europa League semis.

title: The 11 most important fights of Canelo Alvarez's career
content: Nick Parkinson picks Canelo's most important boxing performances and shares his thoughts on each of them.

title: Mock draft: Ja'Marr Chase goes No. 1, Ashton Jeanty in top 5
content: No surprise at No. 1, but it didn't take long for the first rookie to come off the board in our first mock.

title: Five rookies with breakout potential

title: Transfer rumors, news: Champions Liverpool to give slot 'biggest transfer budget'
content: Arne Slot is set to be handed a bumper summer transfer budget by Liverpool. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: White Sox unveil Bulls-inspired first-of-its-kind City Connect uniforms
content: The latest City Connect uniform is the first on-field look that combines brand elements from MLB and the NBA.

title: UFC 318 reactions: What would a BMF title win mean for Dustin Poirier?
content: Dustin Poirier will take on ex-featherweight champion Max Holloway one last time for the BMF title at UFC 318.
